subject: Re: [junit] Printing to a file

messageBody:
Since you said that there are many tests to run and that you run those
from command line and console type of environment. May I suggest the
use of ANT for running your tests? Here is my ANT target that I use
all the time to generate,view and store reports.

<target name="test" depends="compile-test,test-jar">
<tstamp>
<format property="test.run.time" pattern="MM-dd-yyyy-hh-mm-aa" />
</tstamp>

<mkdir dir="testreports" />
<mkdir dir="testreports/${test.run.time}" />
<mkdir dir="testreports/${test.run.time}/xml" />
<mkdir dir="testreports/${test.run.time}/html" />
<junit printsummary="false" fork="true">
<jvmarg value="-Dcom.midas.config.deffilename=config-def.xml" />
<classpath refid="configdef.classpath" />
<classpath refid="test.classpath" />
<classpath refid="httpunit.classpath" />
<classpath refid="commons.classpath" />
<classpath refid="weblogic.classpath" />
<classpath refid="xerces.classpath" />
<formatter type="xml" />
<batchtest todir="testreports/${test.run.time}/xml" fork="true">
<fileset dir="${test.src}">
<include name="**/*Test*.java" />
<exclude name="**/AllTests.java" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
<junitreport todir="testreports/${test.run.time}/html">
<fileset dir="testreports/${test.run.time}/xml">
<include name="TEST-*.xml" />
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="testreports/${test.run.time}/html" />
</junitreport>
<exec spawn="true" executable="c:\Program Files\Internet
Explorer\iexplore.exe">
<arg value="file:///C:/notification/testreports/${test.run.time}/html/index.html"
/>
</exec>
</target>
